text: In the method declaration, what goes before the method name
In the method declaration, what goes inside the parenthesis
Which of the following should be used as a method name
Which of the following is a valid parameter list for a method declaration
What must be unique for every overloaded method
answers: The number or type of parameters

text: Method overloading allows a method to behave differently for different data types
The folllowing is a valid method call: setBalance(int newBalance)
What does it mean to pass a variable to a method by value
answers: A copy of the variable is made so any modifications are made to the copy instead of original variable
A backup is made of the variable so when the method returns, the variable can be reset
The variable becomes final and cannot be modified within the method
The value of the variable is used to tell the method where it is stored in memory

text: Java passes objects by reference instead of by value
Why can an object passed to a method be modified within that method
answers: Because it is the reference to the object that is passed
Because it is passed by value so its values can be changed
Because when the method returns the copy of the object is used to overwrite the original object
It cannot be modified since it is passed by value
